@xJavac wrote:

Their not un-readable lulululul. Last time I checked the Cache uses a gzip storage method (i think a couple more also, not sure I haven’t played with cache since 668 revision). Just re-pack it with your custom icon you have.

item.description:
@xJavac wrote:

Ffs -_-. I’ve already said this is Client sided; Clients load the Cache; the Cache contains the Sprites in the Containers. And I already posted how too do it basically :l. But whatever… this is why less and less people reply too help topics; because people re-post the same stuff over and over.

item.title: Help with this plz
item.dc:creator: @tupperlake67 tupperlake67
item.description:
@tupperlake67 wrote:

public static void donorCommands(final Player player, String[] command) {
if (command[0].equals(“yell”)) {
String yell = getCompleteString(command, 1);
for (Player pl : World.getWorld().getPlayers()) {
pl.sendMessage("[<img="
+ (player.getRights() == 0 ? 2 : player.getRights() - 1)
+ “>”
+ Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(player.getUsername())
+ “]: <col=ff00ff>” + yell);
}
}
}

DO you see where it says [<img=" im pretty sure thats where you post crowns and stuff you want associatedwith that message… but how do you put an image into the file so it would be readable?? can anyone help

Read full topic
